news_header: 59 PSG fans arrested in Germany ahead of Champions League match due to planned clashes.
news_text: Police in Germany arrested 59 Paris Saint-Germain fans before a Champions League match against VfB Stuttgart, citing evidence of planned clashes between fans. The arrests were made after consulting a judge to prevent riots. Some fans arrived without tickets and were found with items to cover their faces. They will remain in custody until Thursday morning. Additionally, 47 Stuttgart fans were banned from the city center for attempting to confront PSG supporters. Previous attempts at clashes were thwarted by police.
